title: RBM governor dares silver - Nation Online
body_text:
RBM governor dares silver
Reserve Bank of Malawi (RBM) Governor Dr McDonald Mafuta Mwale has challenged Silver Strikers to engage an extra gear next season and win more silverware.
He was speaking during the club’s awards gala at Sunbird Capital in Lilongwe on Saturday.
“Silver is one of the clubs that has everything, so they have no excuse not to perform. We expect them to do much better next season,” said Mafuta Mwale who is the club’s patron.
The RBM boss also said they expect the Bankers to, among others, defend the TNM Super League title.
“Having won the league last season, all the other teams will come hard on us, so we need to up our game,” he said.
Mafuta Mwale also reiterated that they will bankroll the team’s participation in the 2025/26 CAF Champions League.
He said: “We want Silver to becom one of the best in the region and our motivation stems from the team’s organisation and performance.
“To that effect, We have challenged them to recruit players both locally and abroad.”
Silver Strikers Company Limited board chairperson Geore Kaudza Masina said they are looking to the future with determination and optimism.
“With new players, a renewed technical panel and the unwavering support of our fans and stakeholders, I am confident that Silver Strikers will continue to shine as a beacon of excellence in Malawian football.
“Our vision remains clear: to dominate locally, compete regionally, and inspire globally. Together, we will achieve this.”
He bragged that the Bankers are more than just a football club.
“It is a family, a legacy, and a symbol of excellence. The recent past season has reminded us of the values that define us: teamwork, resilience, and an unrelenting pursuit of greatness.”
During the ceremony, the central bank, which is the club’s main sponsor, boughtthe team’s new replica jersey at K1 million.
In the awards, midfielder Chimwemwe Idana was named Player of the Season, McDonald Lameck won the Best Defender Award, the Best Goalkeeper Award went to George Chikooka, Binwell Katinji won the Best Striker Award while Chinsisi Maonga was named the most improved player.
Chikondi Gondwe won the women’s team Player of the Season and Top Goal Scorer awards.
